x.description: The amount of velocity to add on the x-axis.
x.markdownDescription: The amount of velocity to add on the x-axis.

y.description: The amount of velocity to add on the y-axis.
y.markdownDescription: The amount of velocity to add on the y-axis.

z.description: The amount of velocity to add on the z-axis.
z.markdownDescription: The amount of velocity to add on the z-axis.

client.description: If this is false, the action will not execute on the client.
client.markdownDescription: If this is false, the action will not execute on the client.

server.description: If this is false, the action will not execute on the server.
server.markdownDescription: If this is false, the action will not execute on the server.

set.description: If this is true, the action will act as a "set" velocity action, overriding the entity's current velocity instead of adding to it.
set.markdownDescription: If this is true, the action will act as a "set" velocity action, overriding the entity's current velocity instead of adding to it.

type.description:
## Add Velocity

---



[Bi-entity Action Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/add_velocity)

Adds or sets the velocity of the target entity, based on the direction from the actor entity to the target entity.

Type ID: `origins:add_velocity`



---

### üìù Note

If the action behaves unexpectedly, try setting either the `client` (should always work) or `server` (might not work) boolean fields to `false`. [Here are some examples.](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/add_velocity)






---

### Examples

```json
"bientity_action": {
    "type": "origins:add_velocity",
    "z": -2
}
```

This example will "pull" the target entity to the actor entity.
